metadata.Title: CVE-2009-3720 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The updatePosition function in lib/xmltok_impl.c in libexpat in Expat 2.0.1, as used in Python, PyXML, w3c-libwww, and other software, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via an XML document with crafted UTF-8 sequences that trigger a buffer over-read, a different vulnerability than CVE-2009-2625.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-3720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.0.1-7ubuntu1
libexpat1 - 2.0.1-7ubuntu1
No subscription required

paraview - 3.8.1-1ubuntu1
paraview-python - 3.8.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

libxmlrpc-c++8v5 - 1.06.27-1ubuntu7
libxmlrpc-core-c3 - 1.06.27-1ubuntu7
xmlrpc-api-utils - 1.06.27-1ubuntu7
No subscription required

aolserver4-xotcl - 1.6.5-1.2
xotcl - 1.6.5-1.2
xotcl-shells - 1.6.5-1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> both this and CVE-2009-2625 refer to the same expat bug: #1990430. See http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2009/09/06/1 This CVE was later assigned to the same issue, since CVE-2009-2625 was worded as a Java vulnerability. Our USN references CVE-2009-2625 and this CVE will be ignored (for expat). jdstrand provided updates in supported releases for expat, xmlrpc-c, cmake, python-xml, python2.4, and python2.5 ebarretto> this is not an issue for vnc4, for more information see: https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=560949 ccdm94> cmake 3.20.5 and forward uses expat 2.2.10+.

criterions.comment: cadaver: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
coin3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
expat package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.1-7ubuntu1').
libxmltok: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
matanza: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
paraview package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.1-1ubuntu1').
swish-e: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
xmlrpc-c package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.06.27-1ubuntu7').
xotcl package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-1.2').
